result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney C. Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rodney C. Green is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rodney C. Green was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  sex offender assessment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges.  State shall have 60 days to determine.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Rodriguiz's, their residence, family, neighbors, or known felons or drug dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION REVOKED.
Concurrent to 17CF321, 17CM1094 & 18CM70.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail w/Huber privileges, credit for 130 days served; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 1/28/16 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 12/17/15 at 1:15pm and JS 1/5/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Defendant Rodney C. Green appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jennifer Ann Phan appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JThwing. Minutes:    ST called witness KPD Det. DeJonge; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Rose. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered; jury demand by DE.   DE waives DA Pre-trial.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Atty T Rose.
Atty  Terry Rose.
Of service by facsimile.
Atty:  T Rose.

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  9/29/15 @ 930 a.m.  Defendant is on a PO Hold.  $1000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
